SPOM.content: visor effect linked to everything we will say about specter in general > such is the difference btwn le spectre ou le revenant de l’esprit, fut-ce de l’esprit au sense de fantôme en general > supernatural, paradoxical phenomenology, ungraspable visibility of the invisible, the non-sensuous sensuous of Capital, intangibility of a proper body w/out flesh
SPOM.linkedContent: visor effect linked to everything we will say about specter in general > such is the difference btwn le spectre ou le revenant de l’esprit, fut-ce de l’esprit au sense de fantôme en general > supernatural, paradoxical phenomenology, ungraspable visibility of the invisible, the non-sensuous sensuous of Capital, intangibility of a proper body w/out flesh

SPOM.content: via Feuerbach, Marx refers to 2 theologies: 1) ordinary: believes in ghosts of sensuous imagination 2) speculative: believes in ghosts of non-sensuous abstraction
SPOM.linkedContent: via Feuerbach, Marx refers to 2 theologies: 1) ordinary: believes in ghosts of sensuous imagination 2) speculative: believes in ghosts of non-sensuous abstraction

SPOM.content: theology is “belief in ghosts,” belief in general as alliance of 2 theologies
SPOM.linkedContent: theology is “belief in ghosts,” belief in general as alliance of 2 theologies

SPOM.content: transcendence, super-, step beyond (über, epekeina) is made sensuous in its exceeding (excess) the sensuous body, non-sensuous becomes sensuous, one feels what is not felt, suffers where suffering does not take place, phantom limbs (the X marking any phenomenology of perception) [see Descartes’ Meditations on phantom limbs]
SPOM.linkedContent: transcendence, super-, step beyond (über, epekeina) is made sensuous in its exceeding (excess) the sensuous body, non-sensuous becomes sensuous, one feels what is not felt, suffers where suffering does not take place, phantom limbs (the X marking any phenomenology of perception) [see Descartes’ Meditations on phantom limbs]

SPOM.content: commodity haunts the thing, its specter travaille la valeur d’usage (at work in use-value), cette hantise se déplace comme la silhouette anonyme ou la figure d’un figurante qui pourrait être le personnage capital
SPOM.linkedContent: commodity haunts the thing, its specter travaille la valeur d’usage (at work in use-value), cette hantise se déplace comme la silhouette anonyme ou la figure d’un figurante qui pourrait être le personnage capital

SPOM.content: it turns, it changes place, il y a là un pas, its allure belongs to specter/mutant
SPOM.linkedContent: it turns, it changes place, il y a là un pas, its allure belongs to specter/mutant

SPOM.content: capital contradiction, at origin of capital: induces the “pragmatic” double constraint of all injunctions [see POO p. 143n difference btwn “use” & “mention”]
SPOM.linkedContent: capital contradiction, at origin of capital: induces the “pragmatic” double constraint of all injunctions [see POO p. 143n difference btwn “use” & “mention”]

SPOM.content: table dances spontaneously, autonomously, but it moves others too
SPOM.linkedContent: table dances spontaneously, autonomously, but it moves others too

SPOM.content: not just contradiction of sensuous non-sensuous in same Thing, but contradiction of automatic autonomy (spontaneity) > on stage of market, table (commodity) is a prosthesis of itself
SPOM.linkedContent: not just contradiction of sensuous non-sensuous in same Thing, but contradiction of automatic autonomy (spontaneity) > on stage of market, table (commodity) is a prosthesis of itself

SPOM.content: sensuous non-sensuous is Hegel’s time, the possibility of any fetishization and idealization
SPOM.linkedContent: sensuous non-sensuous is Hegel’s time, the possibility of any fetishization and idealization

OS.content: Hegel credits Kant w/ discovering “non-sensuous sensuous” concept of time, “intuited becoming” in itself, w/out empirical sensory content [Copernican revolution]
OS.linkedContent: Hegel credits Kant w/ discovering “non-sensuous sensuous” concept of time, “intuited becoming” in itself, w/out empirical sensory content [Copernican revolution]

OS.content: [Kant & Aristotle treat time as pure form of sensibility (nonsensuous sensuous), because time does not belong to beings]
OS.linkedContent: [Kant & Aristotle treat time as pure form of sensibility (nonsensuous sensuous), because time does not belong to beings]

TN.content: can one figure an untouchable extension? difficult except for intelligible extension w/out body (Descartes, Kant) or insensible sensible (Hegel, Marx)
TN.linkedContent: can one figure an untouchable extension? difficult except for intelligible extension w/out body (Descartes, Kant) or insensible sensible (Hegel, Marx)
